{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

ml contains the code base to process glycan for machine learning, construct state-of-the-art machine learning models, train them, and analyze trained models + glycan reprsentations. It currently contains the following modules:

  • model_training contains functions for training machine learning models
  • models describes some examples for machine learning architectures applicable to glycans
  • processing contains helper functions to prepare glycan data for model training
  • representation can be used to analyze trained models and to obtain glycan representations
  • train_test_split contains various data split functions to get appropriate training and test sets

model_training

contains functions for training machine learning models

train_test_split

contains various data split functions to get appropriate training and test sets

{% raw %}

hierarchy_filter[source]

hierarchy_filter(df_in, rank='domain', min_seq=5, wildcard_seed=False, wildcard_list=None, wildcard_name=None, r=0.1, col='target')

stratified data split in train/test at the taxonomic level, removing duplicate glycans and infrequent classes

df_in -- dataframe of glycan sequences and taxonomic labels

rank -- which rank should be filtered; default is 'domain'

min_seq -- how many glycans need to be present in class to keep it; default is 5

wildcard_seed -- set to True if you want to seed wildcard glycoletters; default is False

wildcard_list -- list which glycoletters a wildcard encompasses

wildcard_name -- how the wildcard should be named in the IUPACcondensed nomenclature

r -- rate of replacement, default is 0.1 or 10%

col -- column name for glycan sequences; default: target

returns train_x, val_x (lists of glycans (strings) after stratified shuffle split)

train_y, val_y (lists of taxonomic labels (mapped integers))

id_val (taxonomic labels in text form (strings))

class_list (list of unique taxonomic classes (strings))

class_converter (dictionary to map mapped integers back to text labels)

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
train_x, val_x, train_y, val_y, id_val, class_list, class_converter = hierarchy_filter(df_species,
                                                                                       rank = 'kingdom')
print(train_x[:10])

['Glc(a1-2)Glc(a1-2)Glc(b1-6)[Glc(a1-2)Glc(b1-4)]Glc(a1-5)Kdo', 'LDManHep(a1-4)[GalOAc(a1-7)]Kdo', 'Rha(a1-2)Rha(a1-4)[Rha(a1-3)]Glc', 'GlcN(a1-4)GalA(a1-7)LDManHep(a1-7)[GlcNGly(a1-4)GalA(a1-3)][Glc(b1-2)]LDManHep(a1-3)[Glc(b1-4)]LDManHep(a1-5)Kdo', 'ManOMe(a1-4)ManOMe(a1-4)ManOMe(a1-4)ManOMe(a1-4)ManOMe(a1-4)ManOMe(a1-4)ManOMe(a1-4)ManOMe', 'GlcNAcOS(b1-6)[Gal(b1-3)]GalNAc', 'Gal(b1-4)DDManHep(a1-6)Glc(b1-4)[LDManHepOPEtn(a1-2)LDManHepOPEtn(a1-3)]LDManHepOPEtn(a1-5)KdoOP', 'Man(a1-3)Man(a1-3)Glc(b1-3)[GlcNAc(b1-4)]GlcA(b1-3)Gal(a1-6)Man', 'GlcNAc(b1-2)Man(a1-3)[Man(a1-6)][Xyl(b1-2)]Man(b1-4)GlcNAc(b1-4)GlcNAc', 'GalNAc(a1-7)KdoOAc(b2-3)GalNAc']
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

seed_wildcard_hierarchy[source]

seed_wildcard_hierarchy(glycans, labels, wildcard_list, wildcard_name, r=0.1)

adds dataframe rows in which glycan parts have been replaced with the appropriate wildcards

glycans -- list of IUPACcondensed glycan sequences (string)

labels -- list of labels used for prediction

wildcard_list -- list which glycoletters a wildcard encompasses

wildcard_name -- how the wildcard should be named in the IUPACcondensed nomenclature

r -- rate of replacement, default is 0.1 or 10%

returns list of glycans (strings) and labels (flexible) where some glycan parts have been replaced with wildcard_name

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
train_x, val_x, train_y, val_y, id_val, class_list, class_converter = hierarchy_filter(df_species,
                                                                                       rank = 'kingdom',
                                                                                       wildcard_seed = True,
                                                                                       wildcard_list = linkages,
                                                                                       wildcard_name = 'bond')
print(train_x[-10:])

['Xyl(b1-3)Rha(a1-3)Xyl(bond)[Xyl(b1-3)Gal(b1-3)]Glc(b1-3)Glc', 'Fuc(a1-2)Gal(b1-4)GlcNAc(bond)Man(a1-6)[Man(a1-3)]Man(b1-4)GlcNAc(b1-4)[Fuc(a1-6)]GlcNAc', 'Man(a1-2)Man(a1-2)Man(a1-3)[Man(a1-3)[Man(a1-6)]Man(a1-6)]Man(bond)GlcNAc(bond)GlcNAc', '4eLeg5Ac7Ac(a2-4)GlcA(bond)GalNAc(b1-4)4eLeg5Ac7Ac', 'Neu5Ac(a2-3)Gal(bond)GlcNAc(b1-2)Man(a1-3)[Neu5Gc(a2-3)Gal(bond)GlcNAc(b1-2)Man(a1-6)]Man(bond)GlcNAc(bond)[Fuc(a1-6)]GlcNAc', 'GlcNAc(b1-3)LDManHep(a1-7)LDManHep(bond)LDManHep(a1-5)[KoOPEtn(a2-4)]Kdo', 'GlcNAc(bond)LDManHep(a1-7)LDManHep(a1-3)LDManHep(a1-5)[KoOPEtn(a2-4)]Kdo', 'Fuc(bond)[Gal(b1-4)]GlcNAc(b1-6)[Gal(b1-3)GlcNAc(b1-3)]GalNAc', 'GalOMe(b1-2)[AraOMe(bond)]GlcOMeA', 'Glc(a1-4)ManNAcA(bond)ManNAcA(b1-6)Glc(a1-4)ManNAcA(b1-6)Glc']
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

general_split[source]

general_split(glycans, labels, test_size=0.2)

splits glycans and labels into train / test sets

glycans -- list of IUPACcondensed glycan sequences (string)

labels -- list of labels used for prediction

test_size -- % size of test set; default is 0.2 / 20%

returns X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
train_x, val_x, train_y, val_y = general_split(df_species.target.values.tolist(),
                                              df_species.species.values.tolist())
print(train_x[:10])

['Xyl(b1-3)Xyl(b1-2)[Glc(b1-3)]Glc(b1-4)Gal', 'Glc(b1-3)[GlcOCoum(b1-4)]Xyl', 'Gal(a1-3)Glc(a1-3)Glc(b1-5)[Gal(b1-4)Glc(b1-3)]Galf(b1-3)Gal', 'D-FucNBut(a1-3)ManOAc(a1-3)Fuc(a1-3)GalNAc(a1-2)D-FucNBut', '6dTalOAc(a1-3)[D-Araf(a1-6)]GlcNAc(b1-3)6dTalOAc', 'ManOPEtn(a1-2)Man(a1-6)[Gal(a1-2)Gal(a1-6)[Gal(a1-2)]Gal(a1-3)]Man(a1-4)Glc', 'D-RhaN(a1-2)D-RhaN(a1-3)D-RhaN(a1-2)D-RhaN(a1-2)D-RhaN', 'Glc(b1-3)Glc(b1-3)[Glc(b1-6)]Glc(b1-3)Glc(b1-3)Glc(b1-3)[Glc(b1-4)Glc(b1-2)]Glc(b1-3)Glc', 'Galf(b1-3)Man(a1-2)Man(a1-2)Man(a1-4)GlcNOAep', '[Glc(a1-2)]RibOP-ol(1-5)RibOP-ol']
{% endraw %}
